title: There Is Always A Master
text:
Mark 9
KJV
28+ And when he was come into the house, his disciples asked him privately, Why could not we cast him out? 29 And he said unto them, This kind can come forth by nothing, but by prayer and fasting.

I brought a mechanic home to work on a fault in my car. He did a lot and spent a lot of time, but he could not solve the problem. 

He then called for reinforcement, and in response to his call, a tall, lanky guy came. He asked that the car be turned on. He stood still for a while, listening to the sound of the engine after which He took a spanner undid a bolt, adjusted it, placed it back, and presto, everything was over. Within a few minutes! 

Yes, in every sphere of human endeavors, there is a genius! 

The same applies in the spiritual, the disciples could not heal a sick person brought to them, but Jesus did to their surprise. 

In private they asked why couldn’t they do it  It was then that He revealed to them the how! . 

 Beloved, what problems, challenges, difficulties etc are you going through? Is it spiritual, physical, material etc? There is an answer, it is with someone!  The mechanic confirmed this to me. Someone knows it better than you! 

The twi proverb always holds “ wô toñ wö yarèeà, wô nyà hû adurô” to wit “ if you make known (market)  your ailment/predicament etc; you’ll get its remedy”. 

There is always an answer /solution to every problem be It spiritual or physical.  This  I learnt from watching the mechanics working on my car. Someone has the solution to your problem!! Look for or go to him/her. 

John Franklin Tamakloe

title: A Burdened Heart
text:
1 Samuel 1
KJV
15+ And Hannah answered and said, No, my lord, I am a woman of a sorrowful spirit: I have drunk neither wine nor strong drink, but have poured out my soul before the Lord.

Lamentations 2
KJV
19+ Arise, cry out in the night: in the beginning of the watches pour out thine heart like water before the face of the Lord: lift up thy hands toward him for the life of thy young children, that faint for hunger in the top of every street.

We all go through life with burdened hearts! No one is exempt for we all experience pain, failure, sufferings of all kinds and disappointment! 

When our hopes and expectations are dashed it places an enormous stress and burden on our minds and hearts! As was the case of Hanna it is so with most today. 

Many a heart is bowed down by the weight of sorrow; pain and suffering. A line of a hymn puts it like this 

“ O heart bowed down with sorrow!
O eyes that long for sight!
There's gladness in believing,
In Jesus there is light.” 

I share these thoughts, o heart that is bowed down with sorrow and any eyes that long for sight, recognize that there is gladness in believing! And also in Jesus, there is light. 

A thought to share with you! For now, the path may be cloudy; but there is light beyond. Hold on and press forward! 

John Franklin Tamakloe

title: A Grateful Heart
text:
Luke 17
KJV
17+ And Jesus answering said, Were there not ten cleansed? but where are the nine?
18 There are not found that returned to give glory to God, save this stranger.
19+ And he said unto him, Arise, go thy way: thy faith hath made thee whole.

A well-known incident that teaches both gratitude and ingratitude! Like the missing nine, many after benefiting from the toil and sweat of benefactors often vanished into thin air! 

Even when they reappear,  they walk,  behave and act like they owe no one anything. Even their benefactors become their enemies, against whom they speak evil! 

Not so with a grateful heart, a grateful heart remembers where it came from, those whose shoulders he stood to reach whatever height he has attained! A grateful heart remembers. It is a remembering heart cultivate and nurture it. 

 A grateful heart is a humble and not a proud heart! He acknowledges the sacrifices others made to enrich his life. 

A grateful heart is a heart that is indebted to all, appreciates all, and is a blessing to all. A grateful heart out of gratitude praises and does not condemn!  Do you have a grateful heart? Let it be seen through how you walk, talk and act.! 

1 Corinthians 4:7 
NIV
[7] For who makes you different from anyone else? What do you have that you did not receive? And if you did receive it, why do you boast as though you did not?

A grateful thought from a grateful heart

John Franklin Tamakloe

title: A Wicked Heart
text:
Proverbs 24
KJV
29+ Say not, I will do so to him as he hath done to me: I will render to the man according to his work.

Proverbs 3
KJV
28+ Say not unto thy neighbour, Go, and come again, and to morrow I will give; when thou hast it by thee.

A wicked heart is difficult to define but is noted ( identified ) by some of the characteristics indicated in the above scripture passages. The contents of a wicked heart are seen through Acts. 

It is a heart that conceives, plans and executes evil as if it was for fun! A wicked heart is a heart that rejoices and stands aloof when others suffer. It is self-centred. 

It is also a heart full of vengeance, knows no forgiveness unless he has paid back evil with evil. It is a vindictive heart! 

It is a hypocritical heart that laughs /smiles with you but will stab you In the back the least opportunity it gets 

Psalm 41:6,9
 NIV
[6] When one of them comes to see me, he speaks falsely, while his heart gathers slander; then he goes out and spreads it around. [9] Even my close friend, someone I trusted, one who shared my bread, has turned against me.

A wicked heart is that heart that will sell you when the price offered is right. 

Though we live, work and walk with people with wicked hearts, there is not much that we can do except to watch, pray and hide under the protective canopy of God.
! 
John Franklin Tamakloe

title: A Content Heart
text:
1 Timothy 6
KJV
6+ But godliness with contentment is great gain.

Proverbs 16
KJV
8+ Better is a little with righteousness than great revenues without right.
( The OT version) 

One of the greatest challenges we face is what some have described as the “ rat race,” the chasing after an illusion! Another is “ keeping up with the Joneses.” 

While the rat race indicates chasing after what seems to us as necessary and ultimate, keeping up with the Joneses involves trying to look like, be like, or have what everybody has, measuring ourselves by ourselves. 

As a result of the above, many have become breathless, tired, frustrated if not disillusioned in life! But why all this? What is it that pushes us into this state of living? 

The answer is simple, *validation*. We want to be seen and recognized! And we think the only way to get this is through acquisitions! 

The answer to all these is contentment! To be satisfied with what one has, I bet you is not easy with many. Why? Because they feel left out, they want to be included. 

So, even though we are godly, the contentment part is missing in our lives. Godliness and contentment is a package you can but pursue without the other. 

Godliness with contentment is a great gain, the opposite;  contentment without godliness is a great loss. For what shall it profit a man if he gains the whole world but loses his soul? 

A hymn writer confessed it this way “Were the whole realm of nature mine, that were a present far too small “. 

Contentment is one of the advices John the Baptist gave to some who came to him 


Paul lived a life of contentment, read it 
Philippians 4
KJV
11+ Not that I speak in respect of want: for I have learned, in whatsoever state I am, therewith to be content.

The writer of the Hebrew letter also admonished; 
Hebrews 13
KJV
5+ Let your conversation be without covetousness; and be content with such things as ye have: for he hath said, I will never leave thee, nor forsake thee.

We have been advised severally by many; read these, 
Proverbs 15
KJV
16+ Better is little with the fear of the Lord than great treasure and trouble therewith.

Psalms 37
KJV
16+ A little that a righteous man hath is better than the riches of many wicked.

So yes, pursue godliness not leaving out contentment, both go hand in hand. 

To conclude on a practical note, contentment is grounded in developing and keeping a *maintenance culture*! If we can maintain whatever we have it will serve us for long. This is the secret of how to be content. 

My take 

John Franklin Tamakloe

title: The World Shall Hear Of Me Again
text:
Acts 1
KJV
11+ Which also said, Ye men of Galilee, why stand ye gazing up into heaven? this same Jesus, which is taken up from you into heaven, shall so come in like manner as ye have seen him go into heaven.

This was said many centuries ago and has remained the main hope and expectation of all believers! 
Can it truly be said that we await with preparation and expectation,  His second coming?  

When was the last time you heard a sermon on The Second Coming? It has been assumed and therefore pushed to the back burner. This explains why the faith of many has grown cold because they’ve lost appetite for heaven. Hmmm 

Rereading these scriptures brought to mind the famous statement often heard at the end of every Fu Manchu film series from the lips of popular actor Christopher Lee, aka Fu Manchu!

In our youth (1960/70) we watched a series of films depicting a notorious underworld figure called Fu Manchu. Though at the end of every series he would be caught, yet before the film is brought to a close he would appear and utter the words “ the world shall hear of me again” 

As naive as we then were, this statement from Fu Manchu frightens us because we see him appear in another episode; we often wonder how he could reappear after his death! Truly, It is great to be young! 

Reading what the angel told the disciples should remind us that  “ 
this same Jesus, which is taken up from you into heaven, shall so come in like manner as ye have seen him go into heaven.”

This means Jesus will return in a physical form and not as a spirit as some claim and will be seen by all! What is unknown is the when! The ‘how’ we know, the ‘where He will come from’  we know. 

Have you thought about this? On that day a great mystery shall be solved as we shall see Him as He is! Whether white, black, yellow-skinned etc we don’t know. That day and hour shall declare! Truly we look forward to that day and His appearance. 

Beloved, since we don’t know the “when” let each be always ready so His return does not take him/her unaware. The question that should be of great concern  is where will He find us? In what state or condition? Peaceful or angry, loving or hating? Etc. Think about this. 

This question worried Fanny J Crosby (1820-1915)  a blind songwriter which led her to write this hymn ; 

1.	When Jesus comes to reward His servants,
Whether it be noon or night,
Faithful to Him will He find us watching,
With our lamps all trimmed and bright?

(Oh, can we say we are ready, brother?
Ready for the soul’s bright home?
Say, will He find you and me still watching,
Waiting, waiting when the Lord shall come?)

2
If at the dawn of the early morning,
He shall call us one by one,
When to the Lord we restore our talents,
Will He answer thee—Well done?

3
Have we been true to the trust He left us?
Do we seek to do our best?
If in our hearts there is naught condemns us,
We shall have a glorious rest.

4
Blessed are those whom the Lord finds watching,
In His glory they shall share;
If He shall come at the dawn or midnight,
Will He find us watching there?

How do we answer these questions? Yes, the world shall hear of Him  again? 

John Franklin Tamakloe

title: Admission Requirements: The Case Of Heaven
text:
John 3
KJV
3+ Jesus answered and said unto him, Verily, verily, I say unto thee, Except a man be born again, he cannot *see* the kingdom of God.

5 Jesus answered, Verily, verily, I say unto thee, Except a man be born of water and of the Spirit, he cannot *enter* into the kingdom of God.

7 Marvel not that I said unto thee, Ye must be born again.

Every human institution requires entry qualifications, these are the words of the Spiritual Chief Registrar stating in unambiguous terms the requirement one must possess if he/she wants to be admitted into Heaven. 

Just as we have Physical Registrars, even so do we have the Spiritual whose requirements must be satisfied to gain admission 

The Spiritual Chief Registrar emphasized the need to be born again as a precondition, a new birth which is different and distinct from what all went through to be admitted into the physical world. 

Hear him ;
“Verily, verily, I say unto thee, Except a man be born of water and of the Spirit”

To show the difference between the physical and spiritual, hear Him 
“That which is born of the flesh is flesh, and that which is born of the Spirit is spirit”

Through physical birth, we were all admitted into the physical world. But to be admitted into the spiritual we must be born anew this time by water and spirit.

All who desire to gain admission to Heaven must meet these conditions; which everyone who has obeyed the words of the Spiritual Chief Registrar here done!

1 Corinthians 12
KJV
13+ For by one Spirit are we all baptized into one body, whether we be Jews or Gentiles, whether we be bond or free; and have been all made to drink into one Spirit.

1 Corinthians 12:13 
NIV
[13] For we were all baptized by one Spirit so as to form one body---whether Jews or Gentiles, slave or free---and we were all given the one Spirit to drink.

When did this take place? The day you willingly surrendered to be immersed and die to the flesh and its desires. That was the day you were born anew. 

 Admission therefore is granted to all who have met this requirement! There is no protocol admission, nothing like fee-paying, or whom you know. 

“Except a man be born again, he cannot *see* the kingdom of God.

“Except a man be born of water and of the Spirit, he cannot *enter* into the kingdom of God”.

To “see” is one thing;  to “enter” is another. Some may “see” but will not enter! But who are these one may ask? 

O these are “sympathizers”.  These are those who have nothing against Christianity but will not be part of it. They do good, and live upright moral lives but are not committed to Jesus. 

It is like a political party, there are members and there are sympathizers. The members are those who are registered, have party cards and pay dues. Mostly they are few. 

The sympathizers are those who love, follow and vote for the party, they are unknown to the party! 

The difference is when the party wins only the registered, card-bearing, dues-paying members who are rewarded.  Sympathizers “see the kingdom “ but are denied any share in it. 

There are many today who are “ Christian sympathizers “who are yet to be “ born of water and the spirit” so they can enter as full members. 

Think again, are you a “sympathizer” or a “member? “

Maranatha 

John Franklin Tamakloe

title: A Question Of Religious Priorities
text:
Proverbs 21
KJV
3 To do justice and judgment is more acceptable to the Lord than sacrifice.

Like humans, God also has His priorities! It is not everything we do that pleases Him, though they do not offend Him. He takes delight in some more than others.  An example is what you’ve read above. Reread it;

Proverbs 21:3 
NIV
[3] To do what is right and just is *more acceptable* to the Lord than sacrifice.

Read a few;  
1 Samuel 15
KJV
22+ And Samuel said, Hath the Lord as great delight in burnt offerings and sacrifices, as in obeying the voice of the Lord? Behold, to obey is *better than* sacrifice, and to hearken than the fat of rams.

Micah 6
KJV
7+ Will the Lord be pleased with thousands of rams, or with ten thousands of rivers of oil? shall I give my firstborn for my transgression, the fruit of my body for the sin of my soul?

8+ He hath shewed thee, O man, what is good; and what doth the Lord require of thee, *but to do justly, and to love mercy, and to walk humbly with thy God*?

Every godly act pleases God, but some more than others; knowing which is the greatest challenge we face as believers. Pray for wisdom and discernment so you know which! 

When it comes to gifts, there is a proverbial statement which has stuck with me “What is a comb to a bald headed?” though he will receive,  thank and bless you for it. It is a gift, yet it is of little or no value to him!

How does God rate the services we render to Him? Keep this in mind,  some bring Him greater joy than others. Let’s do those that bring Him greater joy! 

A thought 

John Franklin Tamakloe
